id: nhs111report-information-model

url: https://project-wildfyre.github.io/careconnect-messaging-r4/GraphDefinition/nhs111report-information-model

version: 4.0.0

name: Information Model - NHS 111 Report

status: draft

date: 3 Mar 2019, 00:00:00

publisher: mayfield-is.co.uk

contact:

description: Information model based on the NHS 111 ITK Report [Specification](https://data.developer.nhs.uk/dms/IUC-3.0-RC1/Domains/IntegratedUrgentCare/Tabular%20View/POCD_RM200001GB02.html).

jurisdiction: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (GBR) (Details : {http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49.htm code '826' = 'United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (GBR))

start: Composition

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Composition

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: informationRecipient

min: 1

max: *

description: ITK informationRecipient. The primary information recipients of the clinical documents are usually expected to perform some action on receipt of a CDA document. There can be more than one primary recipient.

target

type: Patient

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Patient

target

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/HeathcareService

target

type: Person

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Person

link

path: Composition.author

min: 1

max: *

description: It holds details of how and when the author authored the document.

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Practitioner

target

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Device

target

type: Person

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Person

link

path: Composition.subject

min: 1

max: 1

description: ITK recordTarget (The patient whose record is the target for the information in the Document.)

Targets

-TypeProfile
*Patienthttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Patient

link

path: Composition.custodian

min: 1

max: 1

description: The custodian is the legal owner of the document and is the organisation responsible for maintaining the information in the document.

Targets

-TypeProfile
*Organizationhttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Organization

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: informant

min: 1

max: *

description: An informant is a person who informed the author about information contained in the document.

type: Organization

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Organization

target

type: Person

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Person

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: participant

min: 1

max: *

description: Participants are people, organisations or devices that are involved in some way with the CDA document.

target

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Organization

target

type: Person

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Person

link

path: Composition.relatesTo.target[x]

min: 0

max: *

description: This is a related document relationship it links the current document to a related document.

Targets

-TypeProfile
*Compositionhttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Composition

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: documentationOf

min: 0

max: *

description: A ServiceEvent can further specialize the act inherent in the ClinicalDocument.code, such as where the Composition.code is simply 'Procedure Report' and the procedure was a 'colonoscopy'.

Targets

-TypeProfile
*ServiceRequesthttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/ServiceRequest

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: authorization

max: *

description: Details of the authorisation associated with the document

Targets

-ExtensionTypeProfile
*Consenthttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Consent

link

path: Composition.encounter

min: 1

max: 1

description: This is a component of relationship it is used to link the document header to the EncompassingEncounter that the document is documenting.

Targets

-TypeProfile
*Encounterhttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Encounter

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: patientDemographicsSection

min: 1

max: *

description: Patient details - unable to locate in the CDA document

Targets

-ExtensionTypeProfile
*Patienthttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Patient

link

path: Composition.section[x].entry

*Binaryhttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Binary

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: PermissionToView

min: 0

max: *

description: The Permission to View template details the permission to view the care record associated with this message.

*Consenthttp://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/Consent

path: Composition.section[x].entry

sliceName: NHS111TextSection

description: Document Text

name: Information Model - NHS 111 Report
description: Information model based on the NHS 111 ITK Report [Specification](https://data.developer.nhs.uk/dms/IUC-3.0-RC1/Domains/IntegratedUrgentCare/Tabular%20View/POCD_RM200001GB02.html).

link.description: ITK informationRecipient. The primary information recipients of the clinical documents are usually expected to perform some action on receipt of a CDA document. There can be more than one primary recipient.
It holds details of how and when the author authored the document.
ITK recordTarget (The patient whose record is the target for the information in the Document.)
The custodian is the legal owner of the document and is the organisation responsible for maintaining the information in the document.
An informant is a person who informed the author about information contained in the document.
Participants are people, organisations or devices that are involved in some way with the CDA document.
This is a related document relationship it links the current document to a related document.
A ServiceEvent can further specialize the act inherent in the ClinicalDocument.code, such as where the Composition.code is simply 'Procedure Report' and the procedure was a 'colonoscopy'.
Details of the authorisation associated with the document
This is a component of relationship it is used to link the document header to the EncompassingEncounter that the document is documenting.
Patient details - unable to locate in the CDA document
ITK TriageAttachment - This is a base 64 encoded export of Pathway in JSON format
The Permission to View template details the permission to view the care record associated with this message.
